Detailed Description

BtDeviceUnpairRequest is used to destroy a former created pairing of two Bluetooth Devices. The result of this request is that the link key that was created by the Bluetooth Stach during the pairing request is destroyed. So when the former paired Bluetooth Device sends an request with the deleted link key this key is not recognized and the procedure of authentication is started.
See BtDevicePairRequest for a complete description of pairing.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN BtDeviceUnpairRequest::Execute (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Sumbit this request to the Bluetooth Stack.

ExecuteRequest instructs this request to send itself to the Bluetooth Stack for execution purposes.
In the base class of all Bluetooth Requests - BtRequest - there is an interface defined, that all requests must fullfill respectively implement. Some functions in this interface are declared pure virtual because they can not be implemented in the base classes. ExecuteRequest is one of these functions. Because the execution of various requests differ very strong, the implmentation of this function is done by the various concrete request classes.

Returns:
TRUE: The setup of the stack parameters was successfull and the Bluetooth stack accepted the requested operation.
FALSE: Either the setup of the stack parameters failed or the Bluetooth stack rejected the requested operation.

Implements BtRequest.

BtRequestType BtDeviceUnpairRequest::GetRequestType (   )  const [virtual]
 

Get type of this request.

The runtime type information feature is not supported by all compilers which this framework is used with. So a rudimentary type information system is implemnted by this class. Each type of request that has no subtypes (leaf class) must return an unique type identifier. GetRuestType return this type idenifier which is implemented as an enumeration type.

Returns:
A BtRequestType containing the type that describes this request.

Implements BtRequest.

BOOLEAN BtDeviceUnpairRequest::OnMessage (  const Message &  message  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Message dispatching member function.

The OnMessage member function is the first entry point in every dispatcher for the reception of messages. From there on it will be routed to the appropriate On... member function, if it should be handled by this dispatcher or passed back to the superior dispatcher.

Returns:
TRUE: The received message has be handle. No further handling for the message is needed.
FALSE: The received message is not handled by this dispatcher. Route it forward to the next dispatcher.

Implements BtLocalRequest.

void BtDeviceUnpairRequest::RegisterMessages (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Register the required messages for receipt.

After registering itself at an application, the request has to tell the message dispatching mechanism which messages this request is intersted in. RegisterMessage performs this task. For the BtDeviceUnpairRequest the following message is registered: BtDeviceUnpairMessage

Reimplemented from UserDispatcher.

void BtDeviceUnpairRequest::UnregisterMessages (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Unregister the required messages from receipt.

Before unregistering itself from the application, the request has to remove the messages, it is interested in form the message dispatching mechanism. UnregisterMessage performs this task. For the BtDeviceUnpairRequest the following message is unregistered: BtDeviceUnpairMessage

Reimplemented from UserDispatcher.
